alert.note: Alert for Camden; Northwestern Burlington; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Camden and west central Burlington Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Berlin, or 12 miles southeast of Gloucester City, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cherry Hill, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Voorhees, Medford, Lindenwold, Lumberton, Mount Holly, Riverside, Berlin, Magnolia, Chesilhurst, Pemberton, Ramblewood, Sicklerville, Barclay-Kingston, Echelon, Marlton and Leisuretowne. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 5. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 32 and 46. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 32 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.
